• January

    • 1 January

      • 1914

        • Gilbert Green is born.

      • 1937

        • Larry Polson is born.

      • 1938

        • Frank Langella is born.

      • 1943

        • Stanley Kamel is born.

      • 1944

        • Bob Minor is born.

      • 1952

        • Matt Roe is born.

      • 1953

        • Mel Johnson, Jr. is born.
        • Kavi Raz is born.

      • 1954

        • Mic Rodgers is born.

      • 1956

        • Sheila McCarthy is born.

      • 1957

        • Tony Salmons is born.

      • 1959

        • Jon Dweck is born.
        • Albie Selznick is born.

      • 1964

        • Juliana Donald is born.

      • 1965

        • Jennifer Hale is born.

      • 1966

        • Dawn Stern is born.

      • 1972

        • The Twenty-Seventh UK Story Arc continues in Valiant & TV21 #14 with the third of six installments.

      • 1973

        • Anthony Winn is born.

      • 1976

        • Damon Runyan is born.

      • 1983

        • Tiger Shapiro dies.
        • Pocket TOS #8: Black Fire by Sonni Cooper(???) is published by Pocket Books.

      • 1990

        • TNG: The Defector airs.

      • 1992

        • Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country premieres in Australia.

      • 1995

        • Pocket TNG: Balance of Power is published.

      • 1996

        • DS9: Homefront airs.

      • 1998

        • The original release of TNG(???) on VHS in the UK is deleted, in preparation for a re-release later this year.

      • 1999

        • Star Trek: Insurrection is released in Austria, Cameroon, Colombia, Ireland, and the United Kingdom.
        • Pocket DS9 novel The 34th Rule is published.

      • 2001

        • Ray Walston dies.
        • The Millennium Gate begins construction in Portage Creek, Indiana. (VOY: 11:59)

      • 2002

        • Jack C. Haldeman II dies.
        • Benjamin W.S. Lum dies.
        • Meg Wyllie dies.

      • 2005

        • Robert Fortier dies.

      • 2006

        • Jerry Summers dies.

      • 2018

        • Jon Steuer dies.

    • 2 January

      • 1920

        • Isaac Asimov is born.

      • 1922

        • Jason Evers is born.

      • 1932

        • Jeremy Tarcher is born.

      • 1935

        • Peter Henry Schroeder is born.

        • Nancy Vawter is born.

        • Dale Kasman is born.

        • Gary Morgan is born.

      • 1953

        • Paige Pollack is born.

        • Tom Embree is born.

        • John Eskobar is born.

        • Michael Lamper is born.

        • Julie Piekarski is born.

      • 1968

        • Evan Parke is born.
        • Filming begins on TOS: Assignment: Earth.

      • 1971

        • Renee E. Goldsberry is born.
        • The Eighteenth UK Story Arc continues in TV21 & Joe 90 #67 with the third of nine installments.

      • 1975

        • Dennis Calero is born.

      • 1980

        • Star Trek: The Motion Picture premieres in Colombia.

      • 1989

        • Pocket TNG #4: Survivors by Jean Lorrah is published by Pocket Books.

      • 1991

        • Pato Guzman dies.

      • 1994

        • DS9: Rivals airs

      • 1995

        • DS9: Past Tense, Part I airs.

      • 1996

        • UK VHS releases: Star Trek - 30th Anniversary Trial Pack, VOY volume 1.10 (end season 1).

      • 2005

        • Frank Kelly Freas dies.

      • 2011

        • Patricia Smith dies.

      • 2013

        • IDW Publishing's Star Trek: Ongoing #16, "Mirrored, Part 2" is released.

      • 2015

        • James Farley dies.

      • 2021

        • Connie Bosmans dies.

      • 2023

        • J. Patrick McNamara dies.

    • 3 January

      • 1904

        • Hazel Keats is born.

      • 1919

        • John Horton is born.

      • 1926

        • Bill Pratt is born.

      • 1927

        • William Boyett is born.

      • 1932

        • Don Peterman is born.

      • 1935

        • Jeremy Kemp is born.

        • Roma Lee Tracy is born.

      • 1946

        • Charles Lucia is born.

      • 1948

        • Frank Detone, Jr. is born.

      • 1962

        • Ren Hanami is born.

      • 1966

        • Bud La Rosa is born.

      • 1967

        • First draft script for TOS: Errand of Mercy is submitted with final drafts coming 6 and 23 January.

      • 1969

        • TOS: Whom Gods Destroy airs.
        • John Ales is born.

      • 1970

        • The Tenth UK Story Arc continues in TV21 & Joe 90 #15 with the fourth of six installments.

      • 1975

        • Jason Marsden is born.

      • 1976

        • Autumn Leigh Brown is born.
        • Alisen Down is born.

      • 1992

        • Judith Anderson dies.

      • 1993

        • DS9 is launched in the US on first-run syndication by Paramount Pictures's Viacom, piloting with the episode Emissary. The series was created by Rick Berman and Michael Piller, having begun production in the last half of 1992.

      • 1996

        • Oscar Katz dies.

      • 1998

        • DS9: Waltz airs.

      • 2003

        • Star Trek Nemesis is released in the UK.

      • 2018

        • DS9(???) celebrates the 25th anniversary of its premiere episode, Emissary.
        • Jack Hunsaker dies.

      • 2019

        • The Escape Artist, the fourth episode of ST(???), premieres on CBS All Access.

      • 2021

        • Dick Kulpa dies.

      • 2023

        • Season 1, Volume 1 DVD and Blu-ray are released.

        • David Roach is born.

        • Filming is completed on TOS: A Taste of Armageddon.

        • Judy Klass is born.

      • 1974

        • Zak Knutson(???) is born.

      • 1980

        • Zachary Culbertson is born.
        • June Diane Raphael is born.

      • 1982

        • TOS(???) premieres in France on TF1 : Only thirteen episodes were broadcast at the time. The 66 other episodes aired finally in 1986 on the channel La 5.

        • Filming begins on TNG: Coming of Age.

        • Bernie Williams dies.

        • Rudy Cataldi dies.

      • 2023

      • 2233

        • James T. Kirk is born on Medical shuttle 37 in space. (Star Trek)

      • 1995

        • VOY, the fourth Star Trek television series, premieres with the episode Caretaker. Developed by Rick Berman, Michael Piller, and Jeri Taylor, Voyager is the first show to air on the new UPN network.
        • UK VHS releases: Star Trek: The Next Generation - The Full Length TV Movies volumes 1 and 2.

        • Ron Taylor dies.
        • ENT: Silent Enemy airs.
        • Final draft script of ENT: Shadows of P'Jem.
        • In an interview, Rick Berman declares the season finale of ENT Season 1 will "most likely" end with a cliffhanger, to be concluded at the start of the second season.

        • Final draft script of ENT: Stigma is submitted.

        • Hal Sutherland dies.

        • The Short Treks episodes Runaway, Calypso, The Brightest Star, and "The Escape Artist" are released internationally (except USA and Canada) on Netflix.
        • Issue 4 of the Star Trek vs. Transformers comic series from IDW Publishing is released.

        • The Monsters of Star Trek by Daniel Cohen is published by Archway Books.

        • James T. Kirk is born in Riverside, Iowa on Earth. (TOS: Where No Man Has Gone Before, The Deadly Years; Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home; ENT: In a Mirror, Darkly, Part II; SNW: Tomorrow and Tomorrow and Tomorrow)

      • 2285

        • Project Genesis enters its third stage. USS Reliant is dispatched to the Ceti Alpha star system to determine the viability of Ceti Alpha VI for use in the Genesis test. The vessel is hijacked by Khan Noonien Singh. (Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan; ENT: In a Mirror, Darkly, Part II)

      • 2063

        • Zefram Cochrane launches the Phoenix and subsequent First Contact with the Vulcans occurs. (ENT: Regeneration; Star Trek: First Contact; VOY: Year of Hell)
        • In the mirror universe, there was first contact between the Terrans and a Vulcan survey ship. All of the ship's crew were slaughtered. The day was later celebrated as a holy day by the Terran Empire. (DIS: Die Trying)

      • 2378

        • The USS Voyager crew celebrates First Contact Day. (VOY: Homestead)

      • 2385

        • Rogue synthetics launch an attack on Mars, destroying the Utopia Planitia Fleet Yards and setting the planet ablaze. (ST: Children of Mars, PIC: Remembrance, Maps and Legends)

    • 7 April

      • 1915

        • Stanley Adams is born.

      • 1916

        • Anthony Caruso is born.

      • 1942

        • Gabrielle Beaumont is born.

      • 1943

        • Nicholas Corea is born.

      • 1964

        • Michael A. Martin is born.

      • 1967

        • Daris Toussaint is born.

      • 1968

        • April Nocifora is born.

      • 1973

        • The Thirty-Fifth UK Story Arc continues in Valiant & TV21 #80 with the seventh of seventeen installments.

      • 1980

        • Star Trek: The Motion Picture premieres in Denmark and Norway.

      • 1982

        • Jillian Johnston is born.

      • 1984

        • Harry Doddema is born.

      • 1988

        • Ed Speleers is born.

      • 1995

        • Star Trek Generations premieres in Brazil.

      • 1997

        • DS9: Business as Usual airs.
        • UK VHS releases: TOS volume 2.4, DS9 volume 5.5, VOY volume 3.5.

      • 1999

        • DS9: Penumbra airs.
        • Star Trek: Insurrection is released in Belgium and Kuwait.

      • 2001

        • David Graf dies.

      • 2007

        • Remastered version of TOS: The Immunity Syndrome airs.

      • 2009

        • The gala premiere of Star Trek takes place in Sydney, Australia.
        • IDW releases the trade paperback collection of Star Trek: Countdown(???).

      • 2019

        • Seymour Cassel dies.
        • Eric Mansker dies.

      • 2022

        • Two of One, the sixth episode of Star Trek: Picard season 2, premieres on Paramount+.

        • Douglas Trumbull is born.

        • The Twenty-Ninth UK Story Arc continues in Valiant & TV21 #28 with the sixth of eleven installments.

        • DS9: Inquisition airs.

    • 9 April

      • 1922

        • Arthur Batanides is born.

      • 1951

        • Jay Crimp is born.

      • 1954

        • Rosanna Attias is born.

      • 1957

        • Bruce Winant is born.

      • 1959

        • Fred Dekker is born.

      • 1962

        • John Eaves is born.
        • Daniel R. Purinton is born.

      • 1963

        • Chris Cooper is born.

      • 1966

        • Julianne Christie is born.

      • 1982

        • Brandon Stacy is born.

      • 1991

        • An additional scene for TNG: The Mind's Eye was filmed on Paramount Stage 9. The final draft script for TNG: Redemption is submitted.

      • 1997

        • VOY: Before and After airs.

      • 2001

        • VOY wraps shooting. The USS Voyager sets, many of which dated back to 1977's aborted Star Trek: Phase II and were also used for TNG(???) and most of the motion pictures, are dismantled soon after.

      • 2002

        • Principal photography on the first season of ENT ends with the season finale Shockwave wrapping.
        • Insert shots are filmed for "Two Days and Two Nights".

      • 2003

        • ENT: Judgment airs.

      • 2013

        • Running Press reference book Star Trek: Phaser is released.
        • Trade paperback collection of Star Trek: The Next Generation - Hive(???), from IDW Publishing, is released.

      • 2018

        • Russell Bates dies.
        • David Quashnick dies.

      • 2019

        • Pocket TNG novel Available Light, by Dayton Ward, is released.

      • 2152

        • Jonathan Archer is transported back in time from March 2152 by Daniels, who reveals that the Cabal, and not Enterprise NX-01, was responsible for the destruction of a colony on Paraagan II. (ENT: Shockwave)

      • 2342

        • Jean-Luc Picard arranges to meet Jenice Manheim at the Café des Artistes in Paris, but never shows. (TNG: We'll Always Have Paris)

      • 1924

        • Lee Bergere is born.

        • Robbie Robbins is born.

        • Byron Quiros is born.

      • 1974

        • Eric Greitens is born.

      • 1978

        • Anthony Jochim dies.

      • 1981

        • Working draft of Star Trek II is completed under the now-working title of Star Trek: The Genesis Project.

      • 1987

        • Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home premieres in the UK.

      • 1988

        • Haley Joel Osment is born.

      • 1991

        • Paul Stader dies.
        • Kevin Peter Hall dies.
        • Second unit insert shots were filmed for TNG: Qpid.
        • Seven days of filming on TNG: Redemption.

      • 1995

        • UK VHS releases: Star Trek: The Next Generation – The Full Length TV Movies volume 7, DS9 volume 3.5.
        • DS9: Distant Voices airs.
        • VOY: State of Flux airs.

      • 1997

        • Ella Rogers is born.

      • 1999

        • Star Trek: Insurrection is released in Taiwan.

      • 2001

        • Anjini Taneja Azhar is born.

      • 2006

        • G4 television begins airing TOS(???) episodes as Star Trek 2.0, adding such features as on-screen chat, pop-up facts, and a "Spock market".

      • 2007

        • Robert Whitney dies.

      • 2013

        • IDW Publishing hardcover Star Trek - Space-Spanning Treasury Edition is released.
        • IDW Publishing's Star Trek: Countdown to Darkness Issue 4 is released.
        • Trade paperback collection of Star Trek: Countdown to Darkness(???), from IDW Publishing, is released.

        • "Star Trek: Boldly Go, Issue 7", from IDW Publishing, is released.

        • "Such Sweet Sorrow" releases internationally (except USA and Canada) on Netflix and its The Ready Room Such Sweet Sorrow aftershow is released on Facebook Live.

      • 2023

        • Issue 6 of Star Trek, by Collin Kelly and Jackson Lanzing, from IDW Publishing is released.
        • Issue 2 of Star Trek: Defiant, by Chris Cantwell and Ángel Unzueta, from IDW Publishing is released.

Broadcast by the Nippon Television Network Corporation, Japan is the third and last country, after the United States and Canada, where the series was broadcast, while it was still in production. ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%AE%87%E5%AE%99%E5%A4%A7%E4%BD%9C%E6%88%A6(???)

    • 1 June

        • Monty Cox is born.

        • Karl Guers is born.

        • Tim Eldred is born.

      • 1966

        • John Frizzell is born.

      • 1967

        • TOS: Charlie X is repeated.
        • Michelle Sebek is born.

      • 1968

        • Erik Ahl is born.

      • 1970

        • Paula Malcomson is born.

      • 1971

        • Gold Key TOS comic #11: "The Brain Shockers" is published.

      • 1977

        • Meaning in Star Trek by Karin Blair is published by Anima Books.

      • 1980

        • Harold Johns dies.

      • 1984

        • Star Trek III: The Search for Spock, directed by Leonard Nimoy, premieres in US theaters.
        • Pocket TOS #17: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock by Vonda N. McIntyre is published.
        • Pocket TOS short story collection Star Trek III: The Search for Spock - Short Stories by William Rotsler is published.

      • 1987

        • Soundstage filming beings on Encounter at Farpoint.
        • Second unit filming also starts with the first footage shot of the six-foot Enterprise-D model at ILM, which had secured an additional commission to provide the pilot episode with the visual effects.

      • 1990

        • Star Trek V: The Final Frontier premieres in Portugal.

      • 1992

        • TNG: The Inner Light airs.

      • 1994

        • Star Trek Creator: The Authorized Biography of Gene Roddenberry published in hardcover in the US.

      • 1995

        • Pocket TOS #74: The Fearful Summons by Denny Martin Flinn is published.

      • 1996

        • The hardcover edition of Inside Star Trek: The Real Story is released by Pocket Books.

      • 1997

        • The paperback version of Inside Star Trek: The Real Story is published by Pocket Books.

      • 1998

        • UK VHS releases: TNG volume 1.3, DS9 volume 6.5, VOY volume 4.5.

      • 2001

        • Several scenes for the Star Trek: Enterprise pilot episode Broken Bow were filmed on Paramount Stage 18 including the "sun porch" flashback scenes, bridge scenes, and the scenes in the cramped crawlspace.

      • 2003

        • Richard Merson dies.

      • 2005

        • Eddie Smith dies.

      • 2006

        • Pocket SCE eBook Distant Early Warning is released.

      • 2007

        • The Corps of Engineers eBook Signs from Heaven by Phaedra M. Weldon is released.

      • 2016

        • Star Trek: Gold Key Archives Volume 5 from IDW Publishing is released.
        • David Spielberg dies.

      • 2022

        • Leon Harris dies.

        • Three story outlines ("The Cage", "The Women" and "The Perfect World") are submitted to NBC. Despite reservations about the perceived costs and difficulties of producing the stories, NBC chooses the The Cage story line to be developed into a pilot episode.

      • 1961

        • Tom Miller is born.
        • Dana Sparks is born.

        • Scott Wilder is born.

      • 1963

        • John Carroll Lynch is born.

      • 1964

        • Melanie Shatner is born.

      • 1965

        • John Parenteau is born.
        • Chad Taylor is born.

      • 1966

        • The deal between Desilu Studios and model kit company Aluminum Metal Toys (AMT), brokered by Stephen Edward Poe, is successfully finalized. The deal entailed free support by AMT for the production of the Original Series in return for the exclusive rights to market model kits based on the series. The details of the deal were negotiated by Ed Pearlstein of Desilu Studios and Don Beebe of AMT. It was the start of a decades long association of the model kit company with the Star Trek franchise(???). As such, AMT is the earliest known company to hold an official Star Trek franchise merchandise license, and since the license has remained valid without interruption until the present day, also the oldest and most steadfast known franchise partner.

      • 1967

        • Revised final draft script for TOS: The Trouble with Tribbles is submitted.

        • Hilde Garcia is born.

      • 2151

        • Malcolm Reed and Trip Tucker are given the job of installing a prototype phase cannon on Enterprise, as well as building two more from scratch. They are able to accomplish the installation – two fore and one aft – in 48 hours. (ENT: Silent Enemy)

      • 1994

        • Filming begins on Caretaker, the pilot of VOY. Geneviève Bujold is initially cast as Captain Nicole Janeway, but leaves the set after only two days of filming, causing a scramble to recast the role. Kate Mulgrew, Rick Berman's original choice, is given the job.

      • 2001

        • Sixth day of filming on ENT: Breaking the Ice.
        • Final draft script of ENT: Civilization is submitted.

      • 2004

        • Star Trek Generations (Special Edition)(???) is scheduled for release on Region 1 DVD. It is delayed three weeks when an error stating trailers would be included on the bonus disc is identified on the packaging.

      • 2013

        • TNG(???)-remastered premieres on a weekly basis on television in Flanders, the Dutch-speaking part of Belgium. Each episode is aired twice on state-owned channel Canvas (formerly BRT 2) in the morning time slot 10:20-11:05 am and the sub-prime time slot 18:21-19:05 pm. As usual in Flanders, the episodes are not dubbed, but subtitled and, as a state channel, without commercial breaks. The pilot episode, Encounter at Farpoint, is the first to be aired, and the usual episode order is followed. Airing continues well into 2014, but is not completed for the entire series. Belgium's northern Dutch speaking neighbor, The Netherlands, has never aired the remastered series (see: Demise of classic syndication).

      • 2014

        • Don Keefer dies.

      • 2015

        • Star Trek: New Frontier eBook, The Returned, Part 3, by Peter David. is released.
        • Reference book Star Trek Sex by Will Stape is released.

        • Robert Axelrod dies.

        • The Autobiography of Mr. Spock, by Una McCormack, from Titan Books, is released.
        • Star Trek: Starfleet is..., by Robb Pearlman, from Smart Pop Books(???), is released.

        • I Have No Bones Yet I Must Flee, the second episode of the fourth season of Star Trek: Lower Decks, premieres on Paramount+.

        • Ravi Valleti is born.

      • 1987

        • Filming begins on TNG: Justice.

      • 1996

        • Star Trek celebrates its 30th anniversary. UPN broadcasts a special tribute from Paramount Studios hosted by Ted Danson. Nearly the entire casts of all four Star Trek series are in attendance. Mae Jemison and Buzz Aldrin presented them with American flags, each flown in space aboard the space shuttle orbiter.

      • 1997

        • Seventh and final day of filming on VOY: Random Thoughts.

      • 2003

        • Final draft script of ENT: Twilight is submitted.

        • Star Trek celebrates its 40th anniversary.

      • 2001

        • Despite the events of the day, Dennis McCarthy and the orchestra elect to continue recording on the score for "Broken Bow" at Paramount Stage M, rather than postpone the session. McCarthy would later describe this as "the hardest recording session of my entire career".
        • First day of filming on ENT: Civilization and re-shoot of scene 3 for ENT: Terra Nova. Production was shut down following the events on this day.
        • The World Trade Center is hit by two airplanes in a terrorist attack. (ENT: Storm Front, Part II)

        • Eric Chauvin is born.

      • 1965

        • The Enterprise model is filmed in the configuration as seen in Where No Man Has Gone Before. This continues the detailing of the model that first started in January. More changes will be made to the model for the eventual series in 1966.
        • Kenneth Hite is born.

      • 1966

        • TOS: Charlie X airs; it is reviewed the following day by Jack Gould in The New York Times. "The accent," Gould writes, "was less on the super-duper gadgetry usually associated with travel in the heavens than on astronautical soap opera that suffers from interminable flight drag. It was TV's first psychodrama in orbit."

      • 1967

        • TOS: Amok Time airs on NBC as the first episode of the second season.

      • 1968

        • Susan Patterson is born.

      • 1970

        • Robert Bonchune is born.

      • 1971

        • Laura DePuy is born.

      • 1973

        • TAS: Yesteryear airs.
        • The Thirty-Sixth UK Story Arc continues in Valiant & TV21 #103 with the thirteenth of sixteen installments.
        • TOS(???) premieres in Flanders, the Dutch speaking part of Belgium, with the episode "De eindeloze ruimte" (Where No Man Has Gone Before). The episode was broadcast on channel BRT 1, in the prime time slot 18:05-18:55. Unlike the French and German speaking parts of the country, the Flanders episodes were not dubbed, but subtitled and over the course of nearly one year, about half of the series was broadcast.

        • Oliver Keller is born.

        • Tom Hardy is born.

      • 2022

        • The Star Trek Cookbook by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel, from Gallery Books is released.
        • Streaming service SkyShowtime is launched in mainland Europe. As the platform also features content as streamed by Paramount+, this means that several Kurtzman-era Star Trek productions become belatedly available for official (and legal) first-time watching in large parts of continental Europe, most conspicuously the first season of Star Trek: Strange New Worlds and the fourth season of Star Trek: Discovery.

      • 1967

        • Chris Eliopoulos is born.

      • 1972

        • The Thirty-Second UK Story Arc continues in Valiant & TV21 #53 with the sixth of nine installments.

      • 1973

        • After the false start in 1971, TOS(???) premieres in The Netherlands with the episode "Waar geen mens ooit eerder was" (Where No Man Has Gone Before). The episode was broadcast by the public broadcast company NOS on the state owned channel Nederland 1, in the timeslot 15:35-16:25 (though the timeslot could shift up, and downwards by as much as 10 minutes later on in the series run) on Sunday on a weekly basis. As usual in The Netherlands, the episodes were not dubbed, but subtitled and over the course of nearly one year, about half of the series was broadcast. However, as with Flanders, the episode titles were translated into Dutch in their TV guides. Neither Dutch nor Flanders TV followed the American broadcast or production order, but broadcast episodes from all three seasons in a rather haphazard order. Unlike the 1971 false start, the NOS follows through with the series, broadcasting approximately half of the original 79 episodes in one continuous run. At the time state-owned both nation's channels did not use the commercial break format.

      • 1991

        • Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry passes away at the age of 70, shortly after the 25th anniversary of his creation. The TNG episode Hero Worship is in production at the time, and the two-part episode Unification I and Unification II is dedicated to Roddenberry's memory.

        • Choose Your Pain airs on CBS, the first US free-to-air broadcast of this episode.

      • 2032

        • John Kelly dies after failing a final attempt to escape from the graviton ellipse. (VOY: One Small Step)

        • Lois Jewell dies.

        • Star Trek: The Original Series Adult Coloring Book from Dark Horse is released.

        • Star Trek is mentioned in the New York Times as one of seven one-hour pilots currently under consideration by NBC. Other pilots under consideration are I Spy, Convoy, Indictment, The Ghost Breakers, The Mayor, and The Wackiest Ship In The Army.

        • William Frankfather dies.
        • CIC Video in the UK rereleases the first eight movies in unified packaging, in pan and scan and widescreen editions. Also released: DS9 volume 6.13 (end season 6), VOY volume 4.13 (end season 4).

        • Pocket SCE eBook Turn the Page is released. This release sees the series become Star Trek: Corps of Engineers.

        • TOS: Shore Leave airs.

        • Patrick Fischler is born.

      • 1973

        • The Thirty-Seventh UK Story Arc concludes in Valiant & TV21 #118 with the twelfth of twelve installments. This is the final story arc of exclusive UK content, concluding a four year run in three different comic(???) magazines.
